b: ^YOU SHOULD NOT CALL afterConversation.afterClock for the Char2 CONVERSATION AFTER HIDING UNDER THE DESK
^You should not be here. Check beginNextConversation knot for possible error.
^Since I no longer have the clock, I cannot see what lies ahead of them.

firstTimeUsingClock: ^I pull the clock out of my bag. It's ominous ticking felt like it was taunting me.
^I don't see any of us wanting this relic.

g-0: ^I shift the clock around, trying to see if there was something of interest.
^I pause suddenly, sensing something at the base of the screen.
g-1: ^I press the button slightly, expecting a puzzle box to open.
^Suddenly, the room begins to phase around me.
^I try to stand but I cannot move.
^The room settles and I see myself sitting in the chair, a sort of out of body experience.
^I try to reach forward, but I notice that I'm just a wisp of blue.
^ are in the room with me, but they don't notice my ghostly presence.
^There's a lightning strike outside, that causes the room to plunge into darkness.
^A gun goes off and I hear someone cry out in pain.
^A smoking gun lies in the middle of the room.
^My other self stands with a wound in his chest.
^ look at him in utter shock.
^He turns to me, as if he could see me.
^: The clock shows you the future, use it well.
^: This happens an hour from your time.
^I see the light leave his eyes as he falls forward onto the desk.
^I loose focus, the scene starts warping around me again until I'm back to the present.
^I stuff the clock back into the bag, terrified by what I had seen.
g-2: ^I force myself to take a deep breath.
^Whatever I do next might lead to or away from that.

useClockNormally: ^I pull out the clock again. It seems to leer at me.
^Ignore the clock and wait for the next person.

b: ^That way they might not see me and I can test if the vision changes!

^Maybe I could try hiding again!

^It couldn't hurt, could it?

c-0: ^I rush to hide under the desk, holding my breath as I waited.

b: ^Devnote: I should not have arrived to this point. Check the hideUnderDesk node.

char1conversation: ^I walk into the mansion, entering the room at the end of the old saloon, closing the door behind me.
^I could use this space to speak to each of my siblings...
^I take a few minutes to prepare, reading the will, before I take my seat.
^Shortly after, someone knocks on the door.

g-0: ^She looks much more like our mother than I had anticipated.
^The same caring smile from our childhood greets me.
^: Benjamin! It’s good to finally see you!

c-2: ^: Likewise. I wouldn't want to take too much of your time.

Jane1A: ^: It’s good to see you too sis, I hope you’ve been well.
^: That’s not what Jacob had to say—
^: Oh why that boy, snitching on his own mother!
^: (Laughs) Sounds like you when you were younger.
^: (Scoffs) I did nothing of the sort!
^: Looks like you're feeling better now.

c-1: ^: Now, if we could talk about why we're here...

Jane1Asplit: ^: Doing good. He would've loved to meet you, but I insisted he shouldn't visit the mansion.
^: He's never been here, has he?
^: Never has and never will if I can help it.
^: (Scowls) I'd like to keep my boy away from the memory of that man as much as I can.

c-0: ^: Jane, I know you’d prefer to talk more, but there's something important I need to discuss...

Jane1B: ^: (Nods) Let’s get on with it, I hope this is the last I hear of him
^: Father left you the clock, he also said—
^: (Interrupts) I’m not taking that clock. I want nothing to do with it.
^: He spent more time with that blasted thing than with any of us.
Jane2A: ^: I understand, I really do. But what if there’s something within this clock that explains it? Maybe we’ll finally understand why he was so fixated on it.
^: (Upset) I cannot, Benjamin.  I will not have that accursed thing in my home, and you best get rid of it before it consumes you too, brother.
^: Jane, please. I didn't mean to upset you.
^She rushes away in a fury, hissing under a breath that Father had dared to bequeathed her the clock.
Jane2B: ^: (Sighs) To that, I agree... I don't see anyone of us taking kindly to this clock.
^: I'm glad you see my point.
^: But that also means there is nothing else I can give you.
^: I expected nothing from that man, I just came here because I was required.
^: If there's nothing else, I'll excuse myself.
^: I'll see you in town sometime.
^: Very well, see you around Benjamin.
^Jane leaves in a rush, still angered at the notion of being given the clock.
^I hear her venting to Holden that Father had bequeathed her the clock before they fall silent.
char2conversation: ^ enters the room, his heavy boots causing the floorboards to squeak.
^: Benjamin! It's good to see you.

normalConversation: ^Ask about the ring around his neck.

c-0: ^: How are you? I haven't seen you in a while.
^: Doing well. A bit worried though. Harvest season's almost here and Old Jim's not doing well.
^: Oh right! You haven't met Old Jim. He's a Cream Draft stallion, best of all the horses I've worked with—
^: I'm sorry Holden, maybe we should talk about something else.
^: Oh... Of course, I apologise for rambling.
^: You wouldn't want to know about the farm after all.
^: You're a city boy now. Good for you!
c-1: ^: He'd run wild in the fields until we gave him his favourite apples.
^: Of course I do. How could I forget.
^ smiles at you, happy remembering memories from the past.
^: I hope so too. The harvest will be tough without that beast.
^: Mother's ring. She gave it to me before she passed.
^: That's all I have to remember her by...
^: (Sniffs back tears) Sorry, I just miss her.
^: I understand, I do too sometimes.
c-2: ^: We can talk more later, let's focus on father's will now. Shall we?
^: Oh yes, that's why you've come back, haven't you? What does it say?

willReading: ^I glance through the the will, it reads:
^"To my son Holden, I leave my wedding ring, to which he's so fondly attached..."

c-0: ^: To my son Holden, I leave my wedding ring, to which he's so fondly attached...
^: YES! It was the only thing I wanted! Thank you father!
^I pull the ring from my suitcase and hand it over to him.
^ takes off the necklace, adding father's ring beside mother's before wearing it again.
^: Now it'll be like they're with me all the time!
^He leaves the room, humming a tune, clutching at the two rings.
c-1: ^: To my son Holden, I leave ...

c-0: ^: ... The family dagger, may he be able to protect himself from harm.
^I pull the dagger from my suitcase and place it on the desk.
c-1: ^: ... This sealed letter, so he may remember my words when I am no longer there.
^I pull the letter from my suitcase and hand it over to him.
c-2: ^: ... My clock, my prized possession, in the hands of one as capable as myself.
^I pull the clock from my bag and hand it over to him.
^: ... Nothing, for I expect him to create his own path in life.

noRing: ^: He said he'd give me his ring...
^Tell him someone else got the ring.

c-0: ^: He wanted me to make my own path in life?
^: But haven't I been doing that?
^ Looks down at the ring around his neck, holding it as he leaves, looking brokenhearted and lost.
c-1: ^: He gave someone else the ring.
^ leans over the table, looking fierce.

c-0: ^ storms out of the room, probably headed towards
c-1: ^Outside the room, you hear a loud conversation between
^However, it seems to die down after a few minutes.

char2_hideUnderDesk: ^ enters the room, his heavy boots causing the floorboards to squeak.
^I silently pray he doesn't notice me...
^: Huh... Maybe he left to get some water.
^: I should check in the kitchen.
^I hear him leaving, the squeaking boards following his footsteps.
char2_returns: ^: There you are! Where did you go?

b: ^: (Snickers) I guess you succeeded in hiding from this dolt.
^: You idiot, there aren't any other doors in this room.
^: If he had left, you'd have seen him.

char2_returns: ^, you're here for the will aren't you?
^He leaves, closing the door behind him.

char3conversation: ^ enters the room, one hand holding his coat while the other casually in his pocket. He strides towards a chair, sitting down.
^: Hello Cole, it's been a while—
^: You know I'm not one for pleasantries, get to it.

c-1: ^: Its been so long, it wouldn't hurt to talk—
^: (Glares) I didn't come all the way here to listen to you prattle, brother.
^: Read that damn will and let me be on my way.

willReading: ^I glance at Cole's section of the will, it reads:
^"To my son Cole, I leave the family dagger, may he be able to protect himself from harm..."

c-0: ^: To my son Cole, I leave the family dagger, may he be able to protect himself from harm...
^I pull the dagger from my suitcase and place it on the desk.
^He picks up the dagger, unsheathing it with difficulty.
c-1: ^: To my son Cole, I leave ...

c-0: ^: ... My wedding ring, to which he's so fondly attached...
^I pull the ring from my suitcase and give it to him.
^He turns it in his hand, holding it to the light, as if he was trying to find some elusive detail within the metal.
^He stops when he notices my gaze, quickly pocketing the ring.

b: ^I wonder what he made of my lie...
^I assume he'll be spiralling into a host of reasons.
^It might seem cruel, but I needed to do this to survive.

c-1: ^: ... This sealed letter, so he may remember my words when I am no longer there.
^I pull the letter from my suitcase and hand it over to him.
^He flips the letter around, trying to search for something. He brings out a key, quickly slicing the letter open.
^He pauses, looking up suddenly as if a deer caught in the headlights.
^He puts the letter in his coat pocket.
^: Apologies, I'll be on my way then.

b:
^He leaves before I can utter a word.

^Strange, how he can still care for Father's words despite all he's done...

^Unless he treated them differently after he kicked me out...

c-2: ^: ... My clock, my prized possession, in the hands of one as capable as myself.
^I see his face instantly light up as I pull the clock from my bag and hand it over to him.
^: Thank you brother. I'll see you around.

b:
^He leaves without another word, seeming... happy.

^That's odd, isn't it? I hadn't though any of us would be happy to receive that relic...

^Well, if it serves him well, who am I to judge?

c-2: ^: ... Nothing, for I expect him to create his own path in life.
^ narrows his eyes at me suspiciously.
^: I hope you don't take this the wrong way—
^: I'm sure our father saw what was best for us.
^He stands up, walking away. I swallow nervously, waiting for him to leave. He pauses at the door, turning back.

char3_hideUnderDesk: ^ enter the room, pausing at the door for a moment.
^He walks around the desk, sitting in the chair, his gaze directly meeting mine.
^I almost shriek out of utter surprise.
^: You were never good at hide and seek, Benji.
^Tell him you were checking if you'd gotten better.
^Tell him you weren't expecting him yet.

c-0: ^: (Forcing a laugh) I was just checking if I'd gotten any better.

char4_hideUnderDesk: ^She walks towards the desk, her heels clacking over the floor as she stands beside it, too close for comfort.
^She hasn't noticed me yet, I might be able to get away—
^A thin hand reaches from the side, tugging on one of the drawers.
^I yelp in surprise as the drawer opens with a jarring sound.

c-0: ^I stand up, brushing the dust off myself.
^She looks me over, seeming like she was assessing me.
c-1: ^A quick patter of her heels, she whips away the chair, revealing my awkwardly hunched form under the desk.

c-0: ^: I was tying my shoelaces and I got stuck under there.
^She looks me over, seeming like she was assessing me.
^: I'm jolly good, thanks for noticing, how about yourself?
^: (Unamused) I'm doing great, thanks for asking I suppose.
c-1: ^: Sorry, I was just looking for my lucky penny.
^: Oh dear! Did you find it?
^: Yes, safely in my wallet now.
^She looks me over, seeming like she was assessing me.

g-0: ^After half a day of flying, the last thing I want to do is sit in a taxi in this blistering heat.
^But I guess that’s what my father wished for me.
^Even after his death, he can’t help making our lives difficult.
^The taxi driver, Mr. Hendriks speaks up.
^: "It's been a while since you've been here, hasn't it?"
^I'm just here for the will reading.

Hendriks1A: ^: Hasn't been that long. Has it?
^: I guess time flies different for you city-dwellers then.
^: Been a good 20 years it has, if my memory serves me right.
^: Matter of fact, if it wasn't for your father's will, I doubt you'd ever remember our wee town.
Hendriks1B: ^: Yes... It's been a decade or two, has much changed around here?
^: To be honest with you son, I don't think it has. This town's the same old beauty as she was all those years ago.
^: But you be the judge, maybe take a short trip into town soon. After your father's will is read, I mean.
Hendriks1C: ^: I'm just here for the will reading.
PrologueContinue1: ^I gaze out the window, watching as the city recedes, placing us smack in the middle of the countryside.
^It felt foreign, but I remember the warmth this place had when we were younger.
Hendriks2A: ^: Well, everyone knew of the man. A storm cloud of a person he was. Never seen outside the mansion.
^: A very private man. But Holden might know more, lived with the man unto his death he did, ever the dutiful son.
^: Ahem! Not to say you weren't...
Hendriks2B: ^I choose to stay silent, watching the scenery as I let myself reminisce for the first time in years.
Hendriks2BsplitA: ^The golden fields remind me of my mother.
^As bright as the sun, her compassion and charm shining through everything she did.
^I often wondered why she married Father, her antithesis.
^Breathe wrong at dinner and he’d recede into his sanctum with a blazing glare.
Hendriks2BsplitB: ^After mother died, our family fell apart, all of us fending for ourselves under the absence of our father.
^The man enrolled me at a boarding school, Jane and Lily at a convent, he thought we were too troublesome to keep around. Didn't even bother to drop us off himself.
^I was far too enraged with the man to ever come back here. I moved to the city after school and never looked back, until today.
^Oh, the irony. The man who broke us apart is the reason we're all back here.
Hendriks2BsplitC: ^Knowing my father, I wouldn't be surprised if Cole and Holden got all of inheritance.
^After all, he thought of Jane, Lily and I as troublemakers.
^Not that I mind. What could be in that wretched will anyway? I've never seen him work a day, so not money.
^Maybe that decrepit mansion and the farms. Holden would be vying for those...
^And of course! That blasted clock! The apple of his eye, the object he obsessed over, held it over the wellbeing of his own children.
^I doubt anyone of us wants anything to do with that cursed piece of junk.
Hendriks2C: ^: Holden and Jane, yes, they are the only ones who stuck around town.

b: ^: Holden's been working the farm and taking care of the mansion, rarely see 'im around.
^: Like I said, Holden looked after your old man, the mansion and the farms. Rarely saw him around town, unless it was on an errand.

Hendriks2C: ^: Jane on the other hand moved into town after marriage, works as a teacher at the school.
^: Her husband owned a store in town, Jacob, her son has been running it for over three years now, since her husband passed.
^: As for the other two, Lily and Cole, they'll show up to the mansion later today from what I heard.

c-0: ^: Ah… That brother of yours was… unique, to say the least.
^: No one knows what he does now, still not a man of words
^: Quite like your father that one.
c-1: ^: (Scoffs) Who doesn't? Your sister was… of a business mindset, for as long as I can remember.
^: Married into a rich family across the country. You can only guess what she’s here for.
^: She could be here to meet all of us, it's been a while.
^: (Laughs) You always try to see the best in people, don’t ya?

b: ^Mr. Hendriks calls me out of my reverie.

PrologueEndPiece: ^We drive up to an old gateway, tall trees looming over it.
^I snatch my bags, getting out of the car, landing on fresh green grass.
^I sigh, looking up at the mansion in front of me. Not as derelict as I’d expected…
^Let’s see what other surprises it has in store for me.

restartLoop: ^I look at the pendulum clock. It marks exactly 23:15.

b: ^With my last breath, I stand from the chair and look back at the desk.
^: I know you are there. Listen closely. This is how you die in an hour:
^I see myself collapse over the desk.

^I get up from your chair, and look back at the space you just left.

^Yourself: I know you are there. This is not a hallucination. I am you in the future.

^Yourself: You don't have much time, so listen closely:


^Your past self/I looks/look back at yourself.

restartLoop: ^Then you feel the present dragging you back.
^It is 22:15. You need to stop the murderer.

basicEnding: ^Just like the first time, my dead body is waiting for me, still shot through the chest.
^. Again, they don't notice my ghostly presence.
^: Someone shot him! Who did it!? I know it was one of you!
^: Of course it was one of us, we all heard the shot from within the room.
^: Oh, lord! Stay away from me!
^) Probably the same one who murdered
^: (Starting to get red) You take that dirty look away from me, I killed no one, I swear on my momma's grave.
^: We all know who of the three of us is more prone to senseless violence!
^: I did NOTHING, what did YOU do?!
^The argument is hard to follow as the voices rise higher and I loose my focus.
stabbingDaggerEnding1: ^ and yourself are standing alone in the middle of the room.
^: You don't know what I saw, Ben. They both bled to death. It is horrible.
^: Alright, tell me everything you saw, step by step.
^: Do you think you are a detective?! Is this a game to you?
^: (Calmly) No, but it is important that we gather all the facts...
^'s room. The facts are that he stabbed
^. The facts are that our family is broken.
^For a second, future-you glances towards your direction.
^: Ok, did you see a clock anywhere in...
^: Wake up, THEY ARE DEAD! BE MAD FOR CRYING OUT LOUD!
stabbingDaggerEnding2: ^Immediatly, you notice your dead body laying on the desk.
^The family Dagger is stuck inside of your chest.
^You also notice a trail of blood droplets coming and leaving through the office door.
^Only the wind can be heard. Silence ominously fills the room.
stabbingDaggerEnding3: ^The room is no longer pristinely clean like it was before.
^ lays dead with a bullet hole in its chest.
^ cries uncontrollably. She is holding a gun.
^: He, he killed bo-, both of them... I didnt mean to kill him... But, but, he killed them and he was going to, to ...
^Future-you is above her, apparently trying to console her.
^: It was self defence, he had the gun and the dagger. He attacked us.
^: Just because the clock said, said so it does not mean he, he was gonna...
^: I'm afraid it does. Trust me.
^With those last words, future-you turns towards where you currently stand.
char1SavedAndChar2Shot: ^Before you open your eyes, you can already listen to a big argument.
^, bleeding to death through a gun shot in the chest.
^: What kind of monster would shoot their own brother!?
^: I don't know, but it was one of us.
^: Of course it was one of us, we all heard the shot from within the room.
^: It is also interesting that the clock she was holding is no longer on her.
^: Stop worrying about the damn clock, someone is DEAD!
^You catch a quick glance from future-you towards your direction.
char1DeadAndChar2Shot: ^With your eyes still blurry, you identify a pool of blood on the floor ahead of you.
^: (Visibly altered) Both of you stay the hell away from me!
^: You stay you creep! You killed
^. You are the only one that could kill both!
^: Yeah, blame me. But the one that has secretly been altering dad's will the whole night is Mr. Executor here.
^: I've been doing that to stop the killer from murdering me. I just did not expect it to end this way...
^: (Clenching his fist) You knew there was a murder and you did nothing to warn us?
^: It wouldn't have worked even if I tried... It doesn't matter anymore.
char1DeadAndEveryoneElseSaved: ^You open you eyes to a crowd surrounding an inmobile Cole that lays on the floor.
^ stands nearby, throughly inspecting a pistol.
^: How could you do it you bastard!
^: The police better take him away before he wakes up. Or I'll have my way with him.

^He punches the table, leaving a considerable mark.
^: He should have tried this with me in the room. How different things would be...
